responses: Web development is creating and maintaining websites or web apps.
It ranges from simple static pages to complex applications like Amazon.
It involves building websites that run on the internet.
Web development includes both how sites look and how they work.

patterns: why do we need web development
responses: Web development shares information through websites like blogs or news sites.
It connects people via social media platforms like Instagram.
It enables online businesses, like e-commerce or banking apps.
Web development automates tasks and boosts digital presence.
Web development fundamentals include frontend (UI) and backend (server) work.
Core technologies are HTML for structure, CSS for style, and JavaScript for interactivity.
It involves responsive design, APIs, and databases like MySQL or MongoDB.
Fundamentals cover version control, security, and deployment.

patterns: what does a web developer do
responses: Web developers create and maintain websites and web apps.
They code the frontend with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for user interfaces.
They build backend logic and connect it to databases.
Developers ensure site functionality and performance over time.
Web development includes frontend, backend, and full-stack development.
Frontend focuses on user interfaces using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Backend handles server-side logic, APIs, and databases.
Full-stack developers work on both frontend and backend.

patterns: what are web dev fundamentals details
responses: Web dev fundamentals include HTML for structure, CSS for styling, and JavaScript for interactivity.
Responsive design ensures sites work on all devices using media queries.
DOM manipulation and event handling make sites dynamic.
Best practices include accessibility, security, and performance optimization.
